edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible
Class Curve3D

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible.Tangible
          edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible.Curve3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISemanticsAware, ISelectable
public class Curve3D
extends Tangible

Defines a CatmullRom curve in the framework that is manipulable by anchor points.

Author:
caprea, Stephen D. Larson (slarson@ncmir.ucsd.edu)

getChildrenCells

public java.util.List<NeuronMorphology> getChildrenCells()
Returns a list of cells that are associated with this curve

Returns:
array list of NeuronMorphologys that 'belong' to this curve. This list is not ordered by anything reasonable (such as time along curve)

setModelBinormal

public void setModelBinormal(Vector3f binormal)
The model binormal sets a vector direction that is defined as the standard for object that are rotated with respect to this curve. Because the dot and cross products are only defined within 0-180 degrees, this is necessary to keep cells rotating around curves in the appropriate manner

Parameters:
binormal -

setModelBinormalWithUpVector

Sets the model binormal simply by defining the up vector and the time

addControlPoint

public CurveAnchorPoint addControlPoint(int index,
                                        OMTVector pos)
Adds a new anchorpoint to the curve. If index is -1 or less, anchor point will be appended to the end of curve

Parameters:
i - the index of which to insert the control point,
pos -
Returns:
